hypothesis_content.title: MSTR Extreme Daily Deviation Reversion as BTC Proxy
hypothesis_content.statement: When MicroStrategy (MSTR) stock price deviates >8% from its implied BTC-holding NAV (using daily BTC close and known treasury), and the broader regime is NEUTRAL or BULL, a reversion trade aligning MSTR with NAV yields a 5% return before a 3% loss over 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: MSTR trades as a leveraged BTC proxy. Extreme premiums/discounts to NAV are often driven by short-term sentiment or liquidity gaps, not fundamentals, and tend to correct due to arbitrage (actual share creation/redemption, or paired BTC/MSTR trades by sophisticated actors).
entry_conditions: Implied NAV = (BTC holdings * BTC price) + other assets - liabilities
Trade in direction of reversion (short if premium, long if discount)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Deviation increases by additional 3% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Deviation persists or widens in >35% of cases, indicating the premium/discount is structural (e.g., due to corporate action expectations) rather than transient.
